query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 «Osanna, sanctus Deus sabaòth, 2 superillustrans claritate tua 3 felices ignes horum malacòth!».
query.error: **English:** 1 "Hosanna, holy God of hosts, 2 supremely illuminating with your brightness 3 the blessed fires of these heavens!".
query.result: 1 "Osanna, sanctus Deus sabaoth, 2 oferglenged mid ðinre beorhtnesse 3 ða gesæligan fyras ðissa heofona!".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 Così, volgendosi a la nota sua, 5 fu viso a me cantare essa sustanza, 6 sopra la qual doppio lume s’addua;
query.error: **English:** 4 Thus, turning to its familiar sound, 5 that substance appeared to me singing, 6 upon which a double light was shining;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 ed essa e l’altre mossero a sua danza, 8 e quasi velocissime faville 9 mi si velar di sùbita distanza.
query.error: **English:** 7 and it and the others moved in their dance, 8 and like the swiftest sparks 9 they veiled themselves from me with sudden distance.
query.result: 7 and hit and þa oðre styredon to hyra þancore, 8 and swylce swiðe hrædlice gnornas 9 me bewrigen of ðære neawnesse.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Io dubitava e dicea ‘Dille, dille!’ 11 fra me, ‘dille’ dicea, ‘a la mia donna 12 che mi diseta con le dolci stille’.
query.error: **English:** 10 I hesitated and said, ‘Tell her, tell her!’ 11 to myself, ‘tell her,’ I said, ‘to my lady 12 who used to comfort me with her sweet words.’
query.result: 10 Ic tweode and cwæð ‘Secge, secge!’ 11 to me sylfum, ‘secge’ cwæð ic, ‘to minre leofran, 12 ðe oft me freoðode mid hire swetan wordum’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Ma quella reverenza che s’indonna 14 di tutto me, pur per Be e per ice, 15 mi richinava come l’uom ch’assonna.
query.error: **English:** 13 But that reverence which overcame me 14 for Beatrice and for Virgil, 15 bowed me down like a man who is drowsy.
query.result: 13 Ac seo arwurðnes þe hine ofercom 14 for Beoðrice and for Virgilie, 15 me abeah niðer swa ðone mon þe slæpð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Poco sofferse me cotal Beatrice 17 e cominciò, raggiandomi d’un riso 18 tal, che nel foco faria l’uom felice:
query.error: **English:** 16 Beatrice endured little of this from me, 17 and she began, beaming at me with a smile 18 such that it would make a man happy in the fire:
query.result: 16 Lytle hwile ða ðolode me Beatrice 17 and ða ongan, blicandemne mid ðam hleahtre 18 ðone ðe on fyre ðone mon geworhte blide:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 «Secondo mio infallibile avviso, 20 come giusta vendetta giustamente 21 punita fosse, t’ha in pensier miso;
query.error: **English:** 19 "According to my infallible judgment, 20 how just vengeance was justly 21 inflicted, has put you in thought;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 ma io ti solverò tosto la mente; 23 e tu ascolta, ché le mie parole 24 di gran sentenza ti faran presente.
query.error: **English:** 22 but I will quickly free your mind; 23 and you listen, for my words 24 will make you aware of a great truth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Per non soffrire a la virtù che vole 26 freno a suo prode, quell’ uom che non nacque, 27 dannando sé, dannò tutta sua prole;
query.error: **English:** 25 In order not to submit to the virtue that desires 26 a bridle for his own good, that man who was not born, 27 condemning himself, condemned all his offspring;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 onde l’umana specie inferma giacque 29 giù per secoli molti in grande errore, 30 fin ch’al Verbo di Dio discender piacque
query.error: **English:** 28 whence the infirm human race lay 29 down through many centuries in great error, 30 until it pleased the Word of God to descend
query.result: 28 ðanon ðæt mennisce cynn untrum læg 29 niðer ðurh fela geara on miclum gedwylde, 30 oððæt ðæm Godes Worde gelicode nider astig[an]

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 u’ la natura, che dal suo fattore 32 s’era allungata, unì a sé in persona 33 con l’atto sol del suo etterno amore.
query.error: **English:** 31 where nature, which had separated itself from its maker, 32 united itself to him in person 33 with the sole act of his eternal love.
query.result: 31 ðær ðæt gecynd ðe fram his Scyppende 32 wæs alunged, geanlæhte him sylfum on anre persóne 33 ðurh ðone ánan dæd his écan lufe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Or drizza il viso a quel ch’or si ragiona: 35 questa natura al suo fattore unita, 36 qual fu creata, fu sincera e buona;
query.error: **English:** 34 Now turn your face to that which is being spoken of: 35 this nature, united to its creator, 36 as it was created, was pure and good;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 ma per sé stessa pur fu ella sbandita 38 di paradiso, però che si torse 39 da via di verità e da sua vita.
query.error: **English:** 37 but by itself it was banished 38 from paradise, because it turned away 39 from the way of truth and from its life.
query.result: 37 ac ðurh hy sylfe heo wæs aworpen 38 of neorxnawange, forðæm ðe heo gewende 39 of wege soðfæstnysse and of hyre life.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 La pena dunque che la croce porse 41 s’a la natura assunta si misura, 42 nulla già mai sì giustamente morse;
query.error: **English:** 40 Therefore the penalty that the cross inflicted, 41 if it is measured against the nature assumed, 42 never killed anything so justly;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 e così nulla fu di tanta ingiura, 44 guardando a la persona che sofferse, 45 in che era contratta tal natura.
query.error: **English:** 43 and so nothing was ever such an outrage, 44 considering the person who suffered, 45 in whom such a nature was contracted.
query.result: 43 andswa næfre nænigwæsmaransceame, 44 geseondæðoneðeðeðrowode, 45 onðæmðæscynneþuswæsgetogen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Però d’un atto uscir cose diverse: 47 ch’a Dio e a’ Giudei piacque una morte; 48 per lei tremò la terra e ’l ciel s’aperse.
query.error: **English:** 46 Therefore, from one act diverse things came forth: 47 for to God and to the Jews one death was pleasing; 48 because of it the earth trembled and the sky opened up.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Non ti dee oramai parer più forte, 50 quando si dice che giusta vendetta 51 poscia vengiata fu da giusta corte.
query.error: **English:** 49 It should not seem too harsh to you now, 50 when it is said that just vengeance 51 was later avenged by a just court.
query.result: 49 Ne ðe ðince nu to stranglic, 50 ðonne man secgeð ðæt rihtlice wracu 51 siððan gewrocen wurde ðurh rihtne dôm.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Ma io veggi’ or la tua mente ristretta 53 di pensiero in pensier dentro ad un nodo, 54 del qual con gran disio solver s’aspetta.
query.error: **English:** 52 But I see now your mind is narrowed 53 from thought to thought within a knot, 54 from which with great desire it awaits release.
query.result: 52 Ac ic geseo nu ðæt ðin mod is gebunden 53 ðurh ðoht on ðoht innanweardlice, 54 ðæs ðu mid micelre wilnunge woldest beon unbunden.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Tu dici: “Ben discerno ciò ch’i’ odo; 56 ma perché Dio volesse, m’è occulto, 57 a nostra redenzion pur questo modo”.
query.error: **English:** 55 You say: “I understand well what I hear; 56 but why God willed it, is hidden from me, 57 for our redemption, in just this way”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Questo decreto, frate, sta sepulto 59 a li occhi di ciascuno il cui ingegno 60 ne la fiamma d’amor non è adulto.
query.error: **English:** 58 This decree, brother, remains hidden 59 from the eyes of everyone whose intellect 60 is not mature in the flame of love.
query.result: 58 Þeos dôm, broðor, stent digol 59 on gesyhðe æghwylces ðæs ðe his ingeþanc 60 on ðære lufe ðære lig ne bið geðungen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 Veramente, però ch’a questo segno 62 molto si mira e poco si discerne, 63 dirò perché tal modo fu più degno.
query.error: **English:** 61 Truly, because this sign 62 is much gazed upon and little discerned, 63 I will tell why such a mode was more worthy.
query.result: 61 Soðlice, forðæm ðe ðis tacen 62 is micel wundor and lyt ðæs andgites, 63 ic secge for hwi ðeos wisan wæs wyrðre.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 La divina bontà, che da sé sperne 65 ogne livore, ardendo in sé, sfavilla 66 sì che dispiega le bellezze etterne.
query.error: **English:** 64 The divine goodness, which scorns 65 all ill-will, burning within itself, sparkles 66 so that it displays the eternal beauties.
query.result: 64 Seo godcundnys, ðe ðurh hine sylfne forhogað 65 ælcne andan, byrnende on him sylfum, scineð 66 swa ðæt he ða ecan wlite awreðeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Ciò che da lei sanza mezzo distilla 68 non ha poi fine, perché non si move 69 la sua imprenta quand’ ella sigilla.
query.error: **English:** 67 That which distills from her without intermediary 68 has no end, because her imprint does not move 69 when she seals it.
query.result: 67 Þæt ðe of hire butan middele geflówð 68 næfð nænne ende, forðæm ðe ne styreð 69 hire insegul ðonne heo hit gesyleð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Ciò che da essa sanza mezzo piove 71 libero è tutto, perché non soggiace 72 a la virtute de le cose nove.
query.error: **English:** 70 That which rains down from it without intermediary 71 is entirely free, because it is not subject 72 to the power of new things.
query.result: 70 Þæt of hire sylfre butan middes ryneð 71 freoh is ealneg, forðæm hit ne onfehð 72 ðære niwan ðinga mægen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Più l’è conforme, e però più le piace; 74 ché l’ardor santo ch’ogne cosa raggia, 75 ne la più somigliante è più vivace.
query.error: **English:** 73 The more it conforms, the more it pleases her; 74 for the holy ardor that illumines everything 75 is more vivid in that which is most like it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Di tutte queste dote s’avvantaggia 77 l’umana creatura, e s’una manca, 78 di sua nobilità convien che caggia.
query.error: **English:** 76 Of all these gifts the human creature is endowed 77 and if one is lacking, 78 it is necessary that it fall from its nobility.
query.result: 76 Ealra ðissa ðinga ðeos mennisce gesceaft 77 hæfð ðone anwald, and gif ðær an bið, 78 ðonne bið ðære æðelbore ðearf ðæt heo befealle.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Solo il peccato è quel che la disfranca 80 e falla dissimìle al sommo bene, 81 per che del lume suo poco s’imbianca;
query.error: **English:** 79 Only sin is that which disfranchises her 80 and makes her unlike the highest good, 81 because of which she is illumined by little of his light;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 e in sua dignità mai non rivene, 83 se non rïempie, dove colpa vòta, 84 contra mal dilettar con giuste pene.
query.error: **English:** 82 and she never returns to her dignity, 83 unless she fills, where fault empties, 84 against evil delight with just punishments.
query.result: 82 andhireweorðmynte næfrenecymeð, 83 butonhiregefylle, ðærgyltæfremað, 84 ongeanunrihtlystrumeðrihtwisra wíte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 Vostra natura, quando peccò tota 86 nel seme suo, da queste dignitadi, 87 come di paradiso, fu remota;
query.error: **English:** 85 Your nature, when it sinned totally 86 in its seed, was removed from these dignities, 87 as from paradise;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 né ricovrar potiensi, se tu badi 89 ben sottilmente, per alcuna via, 90 sanza passar per un di questi guadi:
query.error: **English:** 88 nor can it recover them, if you consider 89 subtly enough, by any way, 90 without passing through one of these fords:
query.result: 88 ne mæg he hine eft findan, gif ðu fæste 89 behealde ðurh ðone deopan sefan, ðurh ænige wegas, 90 buton ðurh ðara wada sumne:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 o che Dio solo per sua cortesia 92 dimesso avesse, o che l’uom per sé isso 93 avesse sodisfatto a sua follia.
query.error: **English:** 91 either that God alone through his courtesy 92 should have remitted it, or that man by himself 93 should have made satisfaction for his folly.
query.result: 91 oððe ðæt God ana ðurh his mildheortnesse 92 forgifen hæfde, oððe ðæt se man ðurh hine sylfne 93 his dysigle forgolden hæfde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Ficca mo l’occhio per entro l’abisso 95 de l’etterno consiglio, quanto puoi 96 al mio parlar distrettamente fisso.
query.error: **English:** 94 Now fix your gaze into the abyss 95 of the eternal counsel, as much as you can, 96 with your attention firmly fixed on my words.
query.result: 94 Nu fæst ðinne gesihð ðurh ðæs abysse 95 ðæs ecan rædes, swa ðu mæge, 96 ðinum mode ðurh ðissa worda geþræc.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Non potea l’uomo ne’ termini suoi 98 mai sodisfar, per non potere ir giuso 99 con umiltate obedïendo poi,
query.error: **English:** 97 Man could not satisfy the terms imposed on him, 98 never being able to go down 99 with humility, obeying afterwards,
query.result: 97 Ne mihte se man on his terminum 98 næfre ðæs gesælig, forðæm he ne mihte bugan 99 mid eadmodnesse, ðe he ða æfter ðam,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 quanto disobediendo intese ir suso; 101 e questa è la cagion per che l’uom fue 102 da poter sodisfar per sé dischiuso.
query.error: **English:** 100 as much as he intended to go up by disobeying; 101 and this is the reason why man was 102 excluded from being able to satisfy for himself.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Dunque a Dio convenia con le vie sue 104 riparar l’omo a sua intera vita, 105 dico con l’una, o ver con amendue.
query.error: **English:** 103 Therefore it was necessary for man to be restored to his full life by God's ways, 104 I say, either by one or by both of them.
query.result: 103 Þonne wæs ðearf ðæt God ðurh his wegas 104 geworhte ðæt man wurde eft on his fullan life, 105 ðæt is ðurh ða ænne oððe ðurh ða twegen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Ma perché l’ovra tanto è più gradita 107 da l’operante, quanto più appresenta 108 de la bontà del core ond’ ell’ è uscita,
query.error: **English:** 106 But because the work is all the more pleasing 107 to the worker, the more it represents 108 the goodness of the heart from which it came forth,
query.result: 106 Ac forðæm ðe ðæt weorc is ðe selre 107 ðam wyrcende, swa hit ðe selre cyð 108 ðæs heortan godnesse ðanon hit cóm,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 la divina bontà che ’l mondo imprenta, 110 di proceder per tutte le sue vie, 111 a rilevarvi suso, fu contenta.
query.error: **English:** 109 the divine goodness that imprints the world, 110 was content to proceed through all its ways, 111 in order to raise you up on high.
query.result: 109 ðæt godcunde god ðe ðone world gesceóp, 110 ðurh ealle his wegas to farenne, 111 eow to árfæstenne, wæs blíðe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Né tra l’ultima notte e ’l primo die 113 sì alto o sì magnifico processo, 114 o per l’una o per l’altra, fu o fie:
query.error: **English:** 112 Nor between the last night and the first day 113 was there ever so high or magnificent a process, 114 either for the one or for the other, or ever will be:
query.result: 112 Ne betwux ðære læstan nihte and ðam ærestan dæge 113 swa heh ne swa mærlic proces, 114 ðurh ðone ænne oððe ðurh ðone oðerne, wæs oððe bið:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 ché più largo fu Dio a dar sé stesso 116 per far l’uom sufficiente a rilevarsi, 117 che s’elli avesse sol da sé dimesso;
query.error: **English:** 115 for God was more generous in giving Himself 116 to make man capable of rising again, 117 than if He had merely forgiven him;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 e tutti li altri modi erano scarsi 119 a la giustizia, se ’l Figliuol di Dio 120 non fosse umilïato ad incarnarsi.
query.error: **English:** 118 and all other ways were insufficient 119 to satisfy justice, if the Son of God 120 had not humbled Himself to become incarnate.
query.result: 118 and ealle ða oðre wegas wæron unmihtige 119 to ðære rihtwisnesse, gif ðæs Godes Sunu 120 ne wære geeaðmodod to menniscnesse.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Or per empierti bene ogne disio, 122 ritorno a dichiararti in alcun loco, 123 perché tu veggi lì così com’ io.
query.error: **English:** 121 Now, in order to fulfill every desire, 122 I return to explain to you in some place, 123 so that you may see there just as I do.
query.result: 121 Nu ðurh ðæt ðe ic wille ðine wilnunga afyllan, 122 ic wille ðe secgan on sumere stowe, 123 ðæt ðu ðær mote geseon swa swa ic ðær geseah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Tu dici: “Io veggio l’acqua, io veggio il foco, 125 l’aere e la terra e tutte lor misture 126 venire a corruzione, e durar poco;
query.error: **English:** 124 You say: “I see water, I see fire, 125 air and earth and all their mixtures 126 come to corruption, and last but a short while;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 e queste cose pur furon creature; 128 per che, se ciò ch’è detto è stato vero, 129 esser dovrien da corruzion sicure”.
query.error: **English:** 127 and these things were indeed created; 128 therefore, if what has been said is true, 129 they should be safe from corruption”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Li angeli, frate, e ’l paese sincero 131 nel qual tu se’, dir si posson creati, 132 sì come sono, in loro essere intero;
query.error: **English:** 130 The angels, brother, and the sincere country 131 in which you are, can be said to be created, 132 just as they are, in their entire being;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 ma li alimenti che tu hai nomati 134 e quelle cose che di lor si fanno 135 da creata virtù sono informati.
query.error: **English:** 133 but the elements that you have named 134 and those things that are made from them 135 are informed by created power.
query.result: 133 ac ða bigleofan ðe ðu nemnedest 134 and ða ðing ðe of him geweorðað 135 synd fram gesceaþenre mihte gefrætewod.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 Creata fu la materia ch’elli hanno; 137 creata fu la virtù informante 138 in queste stelle che ’ntorno a lor vanno.
query.error: **English:** 136 The matter from which they are made was created; 137 the informing virtue was created 138 in these stars that go around them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 L’anima d’ogne bruto e de le piante 140 di complession potenzïata tira 141 lo raggio e ’l moto de le luci sante;
query.error: **English:** 139 The soul of every brute and of the plants 140 draws its potential power 141 from the ray and motion of the holy lights;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 ma vostra vita sanza mezzo spira 143 la somma beninanza, e la innamora 144 di sé sì che poi sempre la disira.
query.error: **English:** 142 but your life is breathed into you directly 143 by the highest goodness, and it enkindles in you 144 such love for itself that you always desire it.
query.result: 142 ac eower lif butan ælcum middele 143 ðone mæstan godcundnysse ðurh ðone gast ontendeð 144 and ða lufe ontendeð on ðam mode ðæt ðu ða lufe symle gewilnige.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
145 E quinci puoi argomentare ancora 146 vostra resurrezion, se tu ripensi 147 come l’umana carne fessi allora
query.error: **English:** 145 And hence you can further reason 146 about your resurrection, if you think again 147 how human flesh was made then
query.result: 145 And ðanon ðu miht ðin agen ðing smeagan 146 ðinne æriste, gif ðu ðenceð 147 hu ðæt mennisce flæsc ða geworðen wæs

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
148 che li primi parenti intrambo fensi».
query.error: **English:** 148 when both the first parents were made.
query.result: 148 ða ða ða forman magas begen wurdon.
